dcterms:creator: Alekh Agarwal
Sham M. Kakade
Jason D. Lee
Gaurav Mahajan
dcterms:description: The paper discusses the convergence of policy gradients in reinforcement learning, particularly focusing on monotonicity properties and their implications for stability.

dcterms:creator: Benjamin Recht
dcterms:description: The work provides insights into reinforcement learning from the perspective of continuous control, highlighting stability issues.

dcterms:creator: Richard S Sutton
Andrew G Barto
dcterms:description: This foundational text on reinforcement learning introduces key concepts and methods, including the challenges associated with stability.

dcterms:creator: Yousef Saad
dcterms:description: The book discusses iterative methods for solving sparse linear systems, relevant for understanding convergence in numerical methods.

dcterms:creator: Michael G. Crandall
Pierre-Louis Lions
dcterms:description: This paper discusses viscosity solutions of Hamilton-Jacobi equations, which are relevant for understanding stability in numerical methods.

dcterms:creator: Michael G. Crandall
Andrew Majda
dcterms:description: The paper presents monotone difference approximations for scalar conservation laws, contributing to the understanding of numerical stability.

dcterms:creator: Guy Barles
Panagiotis E. Souganidis
dcterms:description: This work discusses the convergence of approximation schemes for fully nonlinear second order equations, relevant for numerical stability.

dcterms:creator: Michael G. Crandall
Hitoshi Ishii
Pierre-Louis Lions
dcterms:description: This guide provides insights into viscosity solutions of second order partial differential equations, relevant for numerical methods.

dcterms:creator: Peter A. Forsyth
George Labahn
dcterms:description: This paper discusses numerical methods for controlled Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman PDEs in finance, relevant for understanding stability.

dcterms:creator: Sergei K. Godunov
I. Bohachevsky
dcterms:description: The paper presents a finite difference method for numerical computation of discontinuous solutions in fluid dynamics, relevant for stability analysis.

dcterms:creator: Nikolay V. Krylov
dcterms:description: This book discusses controlled diffusion processes, relevant for understanding stochastic modeling in reinforcement learning.

dcterms:creator: Herbert Robbins
Sutton Monro
dcterms:description: This paper introduces a stochastic approximation method, relevant for understanding convergence in reinforcement learning.
